article.title: 9 Best Animal Cafes In Seoul, South Korea
article.lead_paragraph: South Korea is on the rise and has become one of the most popular tourist destinations in the world. Everyone who visits will undoubtedly head to Seoul. The city has everything, from traditional Korean buildings and modern skyscrapers to street markets and chic bars and clubs. Gyeongbokgung Palace is an attraction that is not to be missed. The palace is so huge that it has more than 7,000 rooms. If you feel tired, you can relax a bit near the lake or refresh around the lush trees in the park of the palace. Here, try wearing Hanbok, the traditional Korean outfit, and be a Korean for the day. Bukhansan National Park is another point of interest which you should visit. The park features many hiking trails, a variety of flora and fauna and, of course, spectacular views. To have fun, visit Lotte World. The theme park boasts abundant thrilling rides. You can also enjoy the swimming pools and ice-skating area, among others. For an ultimate getaway in the soul of Korea, we also recommend you to spare time to visit some or all animal cafes available in Seoul as they feature different animals. Read on to learn more about these animal cafes.
article.meta_description: Check out and visit the 9 best animal cafes when you are in Seoul, South Korea.

snippets.title: 1. Wanggwan House Parrot Cafe
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BNRgZ5VAthI/?tagged=wanggwanhouse

The first on the list is Wanggwan House Parrot Cafe. Bird lovers, especially those who are fond of parrots, should definitely stop by this animal cafe to interact with pretty and smart parrots. A selection of hot and cold beverages are available to be enjoyed while spending time relaxing and viewing the birds. The cafe sells snacks for the parrots if you are interested in feeding them.

> #### Wanggwan House Parrot Cafe
>
> **Address**:  2nd floor, 101-5 Daehyeon-dong, Seodaemun-gu, Seoul, South Korea
>
> **Opening Hours**: 11AM - 7PM

embed.value_html: OEmbed fetch flag has been disabled, enable it for HTML

snippets.title: 2. Bau House Dog Cafe
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BniQdyul9lf/?tagged=bauhousedogcafe

Who does not love dogs? These man’s best friends are happy to welcome you to Bau House Dog Cafe and shower you with sweet doggie love. All the dogs are well-groomed, healthy and fluffy and you can choose whether to spend time in the small dog area or big dog area. To spend as long as you want to in the cafe to play with your new little friends, you are required to purchase at least one drink and the price is quite costly. It is, however, worth it. A cup of coffee and a few dogs around you, it is the best experience.

> #### Bau House Dog Cafe
>
> **Address**:  64 Yanghwa-ro, Seogyo-dong, Mapo-gu, Seoul, South Korea
>
> **Opening Hours**: 1.30PM - 10.30PM (weekdays), 12.30PM - 11PM (weekends)

snippets.title: 3. Blind Alley
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BD2KU1FD5a0/?taken-by=cafe_blind_alley

Yes, as you can see in the picture, Blind Alley is an animal cafe that is unlike the others because it is filled with raccoons. Despite their mischievous behavior, they will still win your heart every time they look into your eyes. You just cannot resist them and end up giving them treats. Enjoy sweet moments with the raccoons while indulging in a cup of coffee. The coffee menu served here includes Hazelnut Latte, Dark Chocolate Latte and Sweet Potato Latte. You can also order from a selection of teas and fresh juices.

> #### Blind Alley
>
> **Address**:  76 Cheongpa-ro 47-gil, Cheongpadong 2(i)-ga, Yongsan-gu, Seoul, South Korea
>
> **Opening Hours**: 10.30AM - 10PM

snippets.title: 4. Meerkat Friends
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/Bms-fj-BIpw/?taken-by=meerkatfriends

People love Seoul because the city is filled with plenty of awesome attractions, including this unusual animal cafe; Meerkat Friends. If the previous cafe boasts its raccoons, Meerkat Friends boasts meerkats, exotic animals that we all love. Enjoy playing with these adorable animals and you can also pet the soft meerkat babies. But of course, before playing with the meerkats, you have to get your hands sanitized. You also need to buy a drink and remove your shoes.

> #### Meerkat Friends
>
> **Address**:  19-12 Wausan-ro 21-gil, Seogyo-dong, Mapo-gu, Seoul, South Korea
>
> **Website**: 1PM - 10PM (Mon, Tue) & 12PM - 10PM (Wed - Sun)

snippets.title: 5. Bunny Cafe
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BWErfjPFEZu/?tagged=bunnycafeseoul

Next on the list is Bunny Cafe. As the name says, entering this cafe means you will be able to meet with fluffy and soft rabbits that will jump back and forth to keep you entertained. No matter how many times you visit this cafe, you will never feel bored. Feed the rabbits with carrots or simply cuddle with them, it really is up to you. You can choose whether to stay for half an hour or one full hour at different prices. You can also enjoy some snacks and drinks in the beautiful garden area.

> #### Bunny Cafe
>
> **Address**:  347-3 Seogyo-dong, Mapo-gu, Seoul, South Korea
>
> **Opening Hours**: 1PM - 10PM

snippets.title: 6. Gio Cat
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BksENrTnXXU/?tagged=giocatseoul

Cats are amazing and they can make you feel relaxed, that is what people say. If you are looking to enjoy some amazing time with more than ten breeds of cats, including Scottish Fold and Persian, Gio Cat is the right cafe for you. You can stroke your favorite cat while taking a sip of your coffee, tea or juice. The cafe can be found near Hongik University.

> #### Gio Cat
>
> **Address**:  12-6 Wausan-ro 21-gil, Seogyo-dong, Mapo-gu, Seoul, South Korea
>
> **Opening Hours**: 1PM - 10PM (Mon) & 1PM - 11PM (Tue - Sun)

snippets.title: 7. Koopet
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/Bn8zwKogVzq/?taken-at=376773571

Not everyone will find this cafe attractive because not everyone likes reptiles. But for a lifetime experience, visiting Koopet is a must. Combining the concept of a reptile cafe and a pet store, Koopet allows visitors to touch and feed all the reptiles. Lizards, snakes, iguanas and tortoises are among the reptiles you can find. As for the menu, you can order an Americano or a selection of organic teas.

> #### Koopet
>
> **Address**:  147-7 Samseong-dong, Gangnam-gu, Seoul, South Korea
>
> **Opening Hours**: 10.30AM - 10PM (closed on Mondays)

snippets.title: 8. Godabang Cat Cafe
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BkOVOyaAW_k/?tagged=godabangcatcafe

Another cafe featuring cats is Godabang Cat Cafe. Before you can meet the super adorable cats, you are required to remove your shoes and wear indoor slippers provided. You will also have to pay for a mandatory drink. Good news is, you are free to stay for as long as you want. When you are inside the cafe, you can roam around and play with those fur balls. 

> #### Godabang Cat Cafe
>
> **Address**:  51-14 Myeongdong 2(i)-ga, Jung-gu, Seoul, South Korea
>
> **Opening Hours**: 1PM - 10PM

snippets.title: 9. Thanks Nature Cafe
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BnMj_1YFS5K/?tagged=thanksnaturecafe

Finally, we have Thanks Nature Cafe, an animal cafe that is quite unique compared to the others because it features cute and fluffy sheep. Have a very good time indulging in delicious drinks and tasty banana-strawberry waffles, the cafe’s popular menu. The best thing is the sheep would like to accompany you and if you touch them with love, they will love you back. In addition to the real sheep, you can also see sheep toys and paintings throughout the entire cafe.

> #### Thanks Nature Cafe
>
> **Address**:  486 Seogyo-dong, Mapo-gu, Seoul, South Korea
>
> **Opening Hours**: 11AM - 10PM

snippets.title: Make new animal friends
snippets.description: There is nothing cuter than animals, be it a sheep, a cat, a dog or even a snake. While enjoying your vacation in Seoul, it is highly recommended to make stops at the animal cafes listed above for a truly memorable vacation in South Korea.

embed.value: There is nothing cuter than animals, be it a sheep, a cat, a dog or even a snake. While enjoying your vacation in Seoul, it is highly recommended to make stops at the animal cafes listed above for a truly memorable vacation in South Korea.

snippets.description: Editor’s note: Trip101 has always been against animal cruelty, and we’re constantly striving to raise awareness for establishments related to animal welfare, such as animal cafes. Please highlight to us immediately if you see signs of poor care or cruelty, and we will do our best to report true facts and fight for animal rights together.

navigator.introduction: Tenissa is a content writer, translator and editor. She enjoys being a globetrotter and has traveled to many countries around the world. So far, her favourite destination is Switzerland. She looks forward to exploring more exciting destinations in the future.
